description: Exports a running or stopped instance to an Amazon S3 bucket.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Exporting an EC2 instance to an S3 bucket involves transferring data over a web service, which aligns with exfiltrating data through a web-based method.
Once the instance data is exported, attackers might delete the original instance or logs to cover their tracks
The export task utilizes application layer protocols for communication, relevant for exfiltrating data using such protocols.
Exporting the instance might include using formats that obfuscate the data of the instance, aiding in defense evasion.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.technique: T1537 - Transfer Data to Cloud Account
unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Exporting an EC2 instance to an S3 bucket involves moving data within the same cloud account and region, but it still represents a transfer of potentially sensitive data to another location within the cloud.
The export task could be used in combination with other tactics to hijack the resource for further malicious activities or unauthorized access.
The instance's data being exported can be seen as collecting data from a local system before transferring it to another location.

securityImplications: Attackers might use CreateInstanceExportTask to extract or exfiltrate information
